answers.answer: Hi, the sensory innervation of the face is through the trigeminal nerve, the fifth cranial nerve. The numbness could be a consequence to neuropathy. It can cause numbness, tingling, unusual sensations and sometimes pain. Treating the underlying cause for neuropathy will help to resolve symptoms. Most common cause for neuropathy is diabetes.  It can also be due to metabolic disorders, vitamin deficiencies, infections and traumatic injuries. Regards.

I know you posted your question months ago but I have had the same problem for years and it has escalated to crawling sensations in my face especially around my eyebrows.  Have you found any relief?   If so, how?  And thanks to Anitha Paderla, DNB as I think I have trigeminal nerve dysfunction duet o autoimmune disorder.    Treatment has not been very effective at all for me.

question: Does anyone else suffering with peripheral neuropathy feel numbness in the lower part of the face?? Almost the same effects as having that novocain shot at the dentist.
title: Annoying symptom
